intro: Lepidoneuron longifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock-rush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes plants adapted to arid and rocky environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late summer. Lepidoneuron longifolium is well-suited to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
